questions.question: He can put ............................ gallons of Coke.
questions.description: To put away is to consume food or drink in large quantities.

questions.question: Criminals who pose a threat to the society should be put ............................
questions.description: To put somebody away is to confine them in a prison.

questions.question: I don’t like it when you put me ........................... in front of my colleagues.
questions.description: To put somebody down is to criticize them.

questions.question: The police failed to put ............................. the riots.
questions.description: To put down a riot is to end it by force.

questions.question: Since the dog had hardly any chances of recovery, we had to put him .............................
questions.description: To put down an animal is to kill it.

questions.question: Her rude behavior put me ...........................
questions.description: To put somebody off is to cause them to feel dislike.

questions.question: The exam has been put ...............................
questions.description: To put off an exam is to postpone it.

questions.question: His insistence that I should lend him some money put me ............................
questions.description: To put somebody out is to cause them inconvenience.

questions.question: My cousin has agreed to put me ............................. when I visit Mumbai next week.
questions.description: To put somebody up is to accommodate them.

questions.question: I cannot put .................................. his impertinence.
questions.description: To put up with something is to tolerate it.

questions.question: Dad is trying to put ........................... a fence around the garden.
questions.description: To put up a fence is to erect it.

questions.question: If banks put ............................ their interest rates, it will hurt the interests of the economy.
questions.description: To put something up is to increase its value.

questions.question: Here is your new blanket. Put it ................................ in the closet.
questions.description: To put something away is to put it in the dresser or closet.

questions.question: Once you have finished playing with your toys, put them ...................
questions.description: To put something back is to return it to the location it came from.

questions.question: My brother is a bully. He tries to put me ...................... every time I open my mouth.
questions.description: To put someone down is to criticize them or humiliate them.

questions.question: The dog was terminally ill. So we decided to put him ....................
questions.description: To put an animal down is to kill it to end its suffering.

questions.question: If you don't mind, I would like to put ........................... a suggestion.
questions.description: To put a suggestion forward is to offer it for consideration.

questions.question: If you keep putting .................... that assignment, you will never finish it.
questions.description: To put something off is to delay doing it.

questions.question: His rude manners really put me .....................
questions.description: When something puts you off, it makes you repulsed or disgusted.

questions.question: You won the first prize! No way - you are putting me ...................
questions.description: To put somebody on is to trick them.

questions.question: Please put ...................... your coat. I am taking you to the doctor.
questions.description: To put on clothes is to wear them.

questions.question: Much of the building had already been destroyed before the firemen managed to put ..................... the fire.
questions.description: To put out fire is to extinguish it.

questions.question: Will it be alright if I arrive a little early? I am asking this because I do not want to put you ................ in any way.
questions.description: To put somebody out is to inconvenience them.

questions.question: Can you put me ........................ to the manager, please?
questions.description: To put someone through to somebody is to connect them to that person.

questions.question: Put ................................ those books and come with me.
You must learn to put .................................. a few dollars a week.
The master exhorted his students to put ................................. those superstitions.
The government sought the help of the army to put .................................. the riots.
I would rather put .................................. these mistakes to carelessness.
They put ....................................... their best effort to win.
Put ………………….. your sweater before you step out. It is very cold outside.
I can’t put ………………………. with my mother-in-law. She is quite dominating.
We all need to put …………………….. some money for hard times.
The meeting has been put …………………… until Wednesday.
He had to spend a lot of money to put his kids ………………….. college.
Should I put the heating ………………….?
Do you think we could put him …………………… for the night?
Good communication skills are essential to put your ideas ……………………
